verses.kjv: And when the seventh month was come, and the children of Israel were in the cities, the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When the 7th month arrived and the Israelites had settled in their towns, the entire community assembled together in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brethren, and builded the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings thereon, as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.
verses.ct: Then Jeshua son of Jozadak, along with his fellow priests, and Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, along with his relatives, got up and built the altar of the God of Israel so they could present burnt offerings on it, following what was written in the law of Moses the man of God.

verses.kjv: And they set the altar upon his bases; for fear was upon them because of the people of those countries: and they offered burnt offerings thereon unto the LORD, even burnt offerings morning and evening.
verses.ct: Even though they were terrified of the surrounding peoples, they set the altar on its original foundation and presented burnt offerings on it to the LORD, both morning and evening.

verses.kjv: They kept also the feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and offered the daily burnt offerings by number, according to the custom, as the duty of every day required;
verses.ct: They also celebrated the Festival of Shelters as prescribed, presenting the required number of daily burnt offerings according to the regulations for each specific day.

verses.kjv: And afterward offered the continual burnt offering, both of the new moons, and of all the set feasts of the LORD that were consecrated, and of every one that willingly offered a freewill offering unto the LORD.
verses.ct: After that, they presented the regular burnt offerings, along with those for the new moon celebrations and all the appointed festivals of the LORD that were set apart, as well as offerings from everyone who voluntarily brought a freewill offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings unto the LORD. But the foundation of the temple of the LORD was not yet laid.
verses.ct: Starting on the 1st day of the 7th month, they began presenting burnt offerings to the LORD, even though the foundation of the LORD's temple had not yet been laid.

verses.kjv: They gave money also unto the masons, and to the carpenters; and meat, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea of Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.
verses.ct: They paid silver to the stonecutters and carpenters, and provided food, drink, and olive oil to the people of Sidon and Tyre so they would ship cedar logs from Lebanon by sea to Joppa, as authorized by King Cyrus of Persia.

verses.kjv: Now in the second year of their coming unto the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the remnant of their brethren the priests and the Levites, and all they that were come out of the captivity unto Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to set forward the work of the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: In the 2nd month of the 2nd year after their arrival at God's house in Jerusalem, Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, Jeshua son of Jozadak, and the rest of their fellow priests, Levites, and everyone who had returned from exile to Jerusalem began the work. They assigned Levites who were 20 years old and older to supervise the construction of the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: Then stood Jeshua with his sons and his brethren, Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together, to set forward the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad, with their sons and their brethren the Levites.
verses.ct: Jeshua with his sons and brothers, Kadmiel with his sons — the descendants of Judah — all worked together to oversee the laborers at God's house, along with the sons of Henadad and their sons and brothers, the Levites.

verses.kjv: And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the LORD, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise the LORD, after the ordinance of David king of Israel.
verses.ct: When the builders completed the foundation of the LORD's temple, the priests took their positions wearing their official robes and holding trumpets, while the Levites who were descendants of Asaph stood with cymbals to praise the LORD, following the instructions established by King David of Israel.

verses.kjv: And they sang together by course in praising and giving thanks unto the LORD; because he is good, for his mercy endureth for ever toward Israel. And all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised the LORD, because the foundation of the house of the LORD was laid.
verses.ct: They sang back and forth to each other, praising and thanking the LORD: 'He is good, and his mercy toward Israel lasts forever.' Then all the people let out a tremendous shout of praise to the LORD because the foundation of the LORD's house had been laid.

verses.kjv: But many of the priests and Levites and chief of the fathers, who were ancient men, that had seen the first house, when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a loud voice; and many shouted aloud for joy:
verses.ct: But many of the older priests, Levites, and family leaders who had actually seen the original temple wept loudly when they saw the foundation of this new house being laid. At the same time, many others were shouting with joy.

verses.kjv: So that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people: for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.
verses.ct: No one could distinguish the joyful shouts from the sound of weeping, because the people were making such a tremendous noise that it could be heard from far away.
